cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to cross central/western Cuba Monday, enter the Florida Straits, then track northward near/along Florida’s west coast before curving northeast across the southeastern U.S. coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (near the Tampa Bay / Nature Coast area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect only for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas (not yet for east-central FL)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings confined to Jamaica and portions of Cuba/Haiti — none issued for Florida as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and western Cuba, Florida Keys, Florida west coast, then the Atlantic coasts of GA–SC–NC
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No – surge guidance presently 1-2 ft or less along east-central FL
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤17%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty squalls possible Tuesday night–Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation of 1–2 ft possible, but significant (>3 ft) surge not anticipated at Port Canaveral
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 2–4 inches with localized amounts to 6 inches Monday night through Wednesday, creating potential for ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous surf/rip currents beginning Tuesday; possible brief tornadoes in feeder bands
